page.title: 17Maypole Ipplepen Flower Show
page.content: When I was five I was an attendant to the Maypole Queen. She had 4 boys and 6 girls from my class to attend her. {The queen and Maypole Dancers' {procession started from the village {square at 2.00.}We walked behind the brass band to the playing field. Then we sat at the base of the maypole. The dancers walked to their ribbons. They started to dance around and around, they did the{Big Chain,}the{Cobweb}and other dances. The brass band played the music. I had a lovely dress on. It was long and white.{The boys and girls were all {in white.}We carried posies of fresh flowers. The maypole ribbons were red, yellow and blue. The maypole{dances were at 3.00 and {at 5.30.}They made a collection, I don't remember what I had. This year the dancers had Â£1.81 each.
